description: I knew this app by asking chat GPT if there is an easier way to make app launchers instead of missing with the files wich is a headache I finally found this app wich is neccessary to install to protect your mental health
summary: this app should be in the OS be default

description: This is the best menu editor I've found! It's really easy to navigate, it works reliably, and it fits the GNOME style beautifully. A must-have app.

https://flathub.org/apps/page.codeberg.libre_menu_editor.LibreMenuEditor

Does its job. From my tests I've concluded that this app has some effects on Steam Deck's KDE Desktop Mode in the menus and elsewhere.
Any change you make after saving is immediate, you don't need to quit the app and start it again for a change to take effect after you hit the save button.

Tested so far:
  * Resetting app after changes works and it restores the app to its original settings and appearance
  * Changing the name of an app in the menu works
  * Changing comment description works
  * Changing the icon path so that the icon can disappear and to change it to another icon works
  * Changing the default command and saving changes works. Emptying the command field and saving does not seem to work as it makes the app appear in default settings in the menu with default name etc. even if you changed them. Deleting the command field contents seems to trigger this behavior. Replacing the command with ie. "gg" will trigger a KDE notification when launching claiming that no program exists called "GG" and the app won't launch and that's expected behavior

Everything else seems to work fine

Before I found this I was writing (often not working) .desktop files manually. 
With this clean designed and beautiful app everything is solved.
It works great on Gnome 46, and is an essencial tool!!
summary: Thank you for the great work!!

description: Me encanta, lo unico por mejorar es permitir poner como icono el enlace simbolico de una imagen
Simply does everything even open the desktop entry document
